title: Table of Values - Construct Function Model

content.description:
<math alttext="t"> <semantics> <mi>t</mi> <annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation> </semantics> </math> (months)

<math alttext="0"><semantics><mn>0</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

<math alttext="1"><semantics><mn>1</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

<math alttext="2"><semantics><mn>2</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

<math alttext="3"><semantics><mn>3</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

<math alttext="4"><semantics><mn>4</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

<math alttext="P open parentheses t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> (thousands)

<math alttext="20"><semantics><mn>20</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

<math alttext="30"><semantics><mn>30</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

<math alttext="45"><semantics><mn>45</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

<math alttext="67.5"><semantics><mn>67.5</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

<math alttext="101.25"><semantics><mn>101.25</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​The increasing function <math alttext="P"> <semantics> <mi>P</mi> <annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation> </semantics> </math> gives the number of followers, in thousands, for a new musical group on a social media site. The table gives values of <math alttext="P open parentheses t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> for selected values of <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, in months, since the musical group created their account on this social media site.
content.question: If a model is constructed to represent these data, which of the following best applies to this situation?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="y equals 20 open parentheses 2 over 3 close parentheses to the power of t"><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn><msup><mfenced><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mi>t</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="y equals 20 open parentheses 3 over 2 close parentheses to the power of t"><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn><msup><mfenced><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mi>t</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="y equals 20 open parentheses 3 over 2 close parentheses to the power of t"><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn><msup><mfenced><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mi>t</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 2.5: Exponential Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
